title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles on summarizing written and spoken conversations, up to 2023
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
This paper introduces BERT, a model that has been widely used for various NLP tasks, including summarization
Pre-training with Extracted Gap-sentences for Abstractive Summarization"** by Jingqing Zhang et al
This paper presents PEGASUS, a model specifically designed for abstractive summarization
**"Text Summarization Techniques: A Brief Survey"** by Ani Nenkova and Kathleen McKeown
A comprehensive survey of various text summarization techniques
**"A Survey of Text Summarization Techniques"** by Gupta, Vishal, and Gurpreet Singh Lehal
Another detailed survey that covers various methods and approaches for text summarization
**"Abstractive Text Summarization using Sequence-to-sequence RNNs and Beyond"** by Ramesh Nallapati et al
This paper explores the use of RNNs for abstractive text summarization
**"SummaRuNNer: A Recurrent Neural Network based Sequence Model for Extractive Summarization of Documents"** by Ramesh Nallapati et al
Introduces SummaRuNNer, a model for extractive summarization using RNNs
**"Towards Abstractive Summarization Using Semantic Representations"** by Yang Liu et al
Discusses the use of semantic representations for abstractive summarization
**"Pointer-Generator Networks"** by Abigail See et al
Introduces a model that combines the benefits of both extractive and abstractive summarization
**"Neural Abstractive Text Summarization with Sequence-to-Sequence Models"** by Jiwei Tan et al
Explores sequence-to-sequence models for neural abstractive summarization
**"Unsupervised Learning for Intrinsic Image Decomposition from a Single Image"** by Tinghui Zhou et al
While not directly about summarization, this paper introduces unsupervised learning techniques that can be applied to summarization
**"Hierarchical Attention Networks for Document Classification"** by Zichao Yang et al
Discusses hierarchical attention networks, which can be adapted for summarization tasks
**"A Deep Reinforced Model for Abstractive Summarization"** by Romain Paulus et al
Introduces a model that uses reinforcement learning for abstractive summarization
**"Fast Abstractive Summarization with Reinforce-Selected Sentence Rewriting"** by Shashi Narayan et al
Discusses a fast approach to abstractive summarization using reinforcement learning

container-title: **"Discourse-Aware Neural Extractive Text Summarization"** by Yumo Xu et al

title: Introduces a discourse-aware approach to neural extractive summarization
**"Leveraging Pre-trained Checkpoints for Sequence Generation Tasks"** by Mike Lewis et al
Discusses the use of pre-trained models for sequence generation, which is relevant for summarization
**"Summarizing Dialogues and Conversations"** by Fei Liu and Yang Liu
A focused survey on summarizing dialogues and spoken conversations

container-title: **"End-to-End Neural Meeting Summarization with Pre-trained Transformers"** by Manisha Sinha et al

title: Explores the use of pre-trained transformers for summarizing meetings
**"Abstractive Dialogue Summarization with Semantic Scaffolds"** by Yang Liu and Mirella Lapata
Introduces a method for abstractive dialogue summarization using semantic scaffolds
**"Towards Faithful Neural Dialogue Summarization with Data Augmentation"** by Xinya Du and Claire Cardie
Discusses the use of data augmentation techniques to improve dialogue summarization
**"Meeting Summarization with Pre-trained Language Models"** by Yang Liu et al
Explores the application of pre-trained language models for meeting summarization
These articles cover a range of techniques and models for summarizing both written and spoken conversations, providing a comprehensive overview of the field up to
